meanings.definition: The act of making something seem environmentally friendly when it is not.
meanings.sent1: The greenwashings of that company fooled many people into thinking they were eco-friendly.
meanings.sent2: Consumers were misled by the greenwashings of the product, believing it was good for the environment.
meanings.sent3: The greenwashings of the old factory were so exaggerated that even the birds laughed at them.
meanings.sent4: Her greenwashings were like painting a desert green, trying to hide the truth beneath a false facade.
meanings.sent5: The greenwashings of the company were like a bright green paint covering up a rusty reality.

meanings.definition: The practice of misleading consumers regarding the environmental benefits of a product or company.
meanings.sent1: The company's greenwashings were exposed when the truth about their pollution came to light.
meanings.sent2: Consumers fell for the greenwashings of the product, believing it was better for the environment than it truly was.
meanings.sent3: The greenwashings of the sneaky salesman were like trying to sell a cactus as a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her greenwashings were like a magician's trick, making the harmful product disappear behind a green curtain.
meanings.sent5: The greenwashings of the company were like a mask hiding the true face of their environmental impact.
